field.name: Date range start
field.definition: the beginning date of an event, embargo period, meeting, correspondence or interview

dos.practice: This field cannot be repeated except by adding another dateRange tag set.
Be sure the start date is before the end date.
Enter beginning and end dates to mark events for presentations/webcasts, posters and proceedings articles.
Use this field for completing dates associated with correspondence or interviews.
Use this field for creating embargoes on resources when they can not be made accessible to the public for a certain amount of time.

In the case of dates of only the month and year, set the embargo to expire on the first day of the first appropriate month (e.g. an article published in a July 2010 would be freed from embargo on January 1, 2011).
Consult with SHERPA/RoMEO to identify any applicable embargo periods.
Due to a UCAR special agreement, AMS and AGU each have embargoes of 6 months, regardless of what SHERPA/RoMEO indicates.
The Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society (BAMS) never has an embargo.
Due to a UCAR special agreement, Springer does not impose an embargo on UCAR/NCAR/UCP publications as long as the publication date is before 2014.

documentation.obligation: required metadata if parent tag is present
documentation.domain: numerical free text in the YYYY-MM-DD format
